metadata.title: CVE-2022-3202 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw in diFree in fs/jfs/inode.c in JournaledFile System (JFS)in the Linux kernel. This could allow a local attacker tocrash the system or leak kernel internal information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3202` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1113-aws - 4.4.0-1113.119
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-azure - 4.15.0-1146.161~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-lowlatency - 4.4.0-234.268~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1113.119').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.161~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-234.268~14.04.1').
